title.narrative: Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Improvement Project - Additional Financing

description.narrative: The Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Improvement Project is working to improve the efficiency and the reliability of the water supply system in the area while at the same time upgrading the infrastructure at the water source areas for the valley. This includes the expansion of the water treatment plant, expanding reservoirs, and providing water connections with a focus on serving the poor and households headed by women.

participating-org.narrative: Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Management Board
Ministry of Water Supply (formerly Ministry of Water Supply and Sanitation)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
100% compliance of water samples with national drinking water quality standards in the project

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men.

title.narrative: At least 13 DMAs in service area (baseline: 0) provided with 24 x 7 water supply

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men.

title.narrative: Average pressure of supply at consumer end increased from almost 0 meters in 2011 to at least 4 meters in all areas

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men.

title.narrative: By the end of the project (by 2020): Average availability of water improved from 45 lpcd in 2011 to 100 lpcd for at least 250,000 households

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men.
